COVETOUS.Definition: jealous, wanting to possess something that belongs to someone else

DARE SAY.Definition: used to indicate that one believes something is probable

DEGENERATE.Definition: having lost the physical, mental, or moral qualities considered normal and desirable; showing evidence of decline

FRANTICALLY.Definition: in a distraught way owing to fear, anxiety, or other emotion

FURTHER AFIELD.Definition: in places or areas other than the nearest or most obvious one

INEXORABLY.Definition: in a way that is impossible to stop or prevent

INFAMOUS.Definition: well known for some bad quality or deed

INHERENTLY.Definition: in a permanent, essential, or characteristic way

PARALYSED.Definition: (of a person or part of the body) partly or wholly incapable of movement; disabled

PURITANICAL.Definition: having or displaying a very strict moral attitude towards self-indulgence or sex

RALLYING CALL.Definition: something such as a word, phrase, event, or belief that encourages people to unite and to act in support of a particular group or idea

RELUCTANT.Definition: not willing, not wanting to do

RESONATED.Definition: (of an idea or action) meet with agreement

VULNERABLE.Definition: (of a person) in need of special care, support, or protection because of age, disability, or risk of abuse or neglect

WHOLEHEARTEDLY.Definition: showing or characterized by complete sincerity and commitment
